text: Margaret "Gretel" Bergmann-Lambert (née Bergmann; April 12, 1914 – July 25, 2017) was an American Jewish athlete. She was born in Laupheim, Württemberg. She competed as a high jumper during the 1930s. Because of her Jewish origins, the Nazis prevented her from taking part in the 1936 Summer Olympics, after which she left Germany and vowed never to return. She later moved to the United States. Bergmann turned 100 in April 2014. Bergmann died in Queens, New York on July 25, 2017 at he age of 103. ==References== Category:1914 births Category:2017 deaths Category:High jumpers Category:American centenarians Category:American track and field athletes Category:German centenarians Category:German Jews Category:Jewish American sportspeople Category:Jewish centenarians Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Refugees from Nazism Category:Sportspeople from Baden-Württemberg Category:Sportspeople from New York City
title: Gretel Bergmann
